<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// An automatic updater for MemorySSA that handles arbitrary insertion,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// deletion, and moves.  It performs phi insertion where necessary, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// automatically updates the MemorySSA IR to be correct.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// While updating loads or removing instructions is often easy enough to not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// need this, updating stores should generally not be attemped outside this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// API.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Basic API usage:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Create the memory access you want for the instruction (this is mainly so</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we know where it is, without having to duplicate the entire set of create</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// functions MemorySSA supports).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Call insertDef or insertUse depending on whether it&#39;s a MemoryUse or a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// MemoryDef.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// That&#39;s it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For moving, first, move the instruction itself using the normal SSA</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction moving API, then just call moveBefore, moveAfter,or moveTo with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the right arguments.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Insert a definition into the MemorySSA IR.  RenameUses will rename any use</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// below the new def block (and any inserted phis).  RenameUses should be set</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to true if the definition may cause new aliases for loads below it.  This</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is not the case for hoisting or sinking or other forms of code &#42;movement&#42;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// It &#42;is&#42; the case for straight code insertion.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For example:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// store a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// if (foo) &#123; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// load a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Moving the store into the if block, and calling insertDef, does not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// require RenameUses.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// However, changing it to:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// store a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// if (foo) &#123; store b &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// load a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Where a mayalias b, &#42;does&#42; require RenameUses be set to true.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#96;From&#96; block was spliced into &#96;From&#96; and &#96;To&#96;. There is a CFG edge from</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#96;From&#96; to &#96;To&#96;. Move all accesses from &#96;From&#96; to &#96;To&#96; starting at</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// instruction &#96;Start&#96;. &#96;To&#96; is newly created BB, so empty of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// MemorySSA::MemoryAccesses. Edges are already updated, so successors of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#96;To&#96; with MPhi nodes need to update incoming block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// |------|        |------|</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// | From |        | From |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// |      |        |------|</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// |      |           ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// |      |   =&gt;      \\/</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// |      |        |------|  &lt;- Start</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// |      |        |  To  |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// |------|        |------|</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssaupdater/#aa7518e6d6d74227a56b36eb88cfe26e6">moveAllAfterSpliceBlocks</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;From, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;To,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#96;From&#96; block was merged into &#96;To&#96;. There is a CFG edge from &#96;To&#96; to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#96;From&#96;.&#96;To&#96; still branches to &#96;From&#96;, but all instructions were moved and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#96;From&#96; is now an empty block; &#96;From&#96; is about to be deleted. Move all</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// accesses from &#96;From&#96; to &#96;To&#96; starting at instruction &#96;Start&#96;. &#96;To&#96; may</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// have multiple successors, &#96;From&#96; has a single predecessor. &#96;From&#96; may have</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// successors with MPhi nodes, replace their incoming block with &#96;To&#96;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// |------|        |------|</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// |  To  |        |  To  |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// |------|        |      |</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// | From |        |      |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// |------|        |------|</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssaupdater/#ae11d36d6d1f06cdf18a0333eab22f381">moveAllAfterMergeBlocks</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;From, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;To,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A new empty BasicBlock (New) now branches directly to Old. Some of</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The below are utility functions. Other than creation of accesses to pass</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to insertDef, and removeAccess to remove accesses, you should generally</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the edge cases right, and the above calls already operate in near-optimal</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// time bounds.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// MemoryPHI nodes, or updating users to point to the new MemoryAccess. You</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Remove all MemoryAcceses in a set of BasicBlocks about to be deleted.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Assumption we make here: all uses of deleted defs and phi must either</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// occur in blocks about to be deleted (thus will be deleted as well), or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// they occur in phis that will simply lose an incoming value.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Deleted blocks still have successor info, but their predecessor edges and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Phi nodes may already be updated. Instructions in DeadBlocks should be</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Clone all uses and defs from BB to NewBB given a 1:1 map of all</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// instructions and blocks cloned, and a map of MemoryPhi : Definition</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (MemoryAccess Phi or Def).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param VMap Maps old instructions to cloned instructions and old blocks</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///        to cloned blocks</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param MPhiMap, is created in the caller of this private method, and maps</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///        existing MemoryPhis to new definitions that new MemoryAccesses</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///        must point to. These definitions may not necessarily be MemoryPhis</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///        themselves, they may be MemoryDefs. As such, the map is between</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///        MemoryPhis and MemoryAccesses, where the MemoryAccesses may be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///        MemoryPhis or MemoryDefs and not MemoryUses.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param IsInClonedRegion Determines whether a basic block was cloned.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///        References to accesses outside the cloned region will not be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///        remapped.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param CloneWasSimplified If false, the clone was exact. Otherwise,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///        assume that the clone involved simplifications that may have:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///        (1) turned a MemoryUse into an instruction that MemorySSA has no</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///        representation for, or (2) turned a MemoryDef into a MemoryUse or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///        an instruction that MemorySSA has no representation for. No other</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///        cases are supported.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> cloneUsesAndDefs(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;BB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;NewBB,</Highlight></CodeLine>
